Title: Great for Thinning Hair
Body: As a male who has had thinning hair for several years, I've tried a number of hair regrowth products from Rogaine to special expensive shampoos. Most of the time I just forget to use them consistently, so I can't really see whether they work or don't. At least with this shampoo and conditioner, I use it on a daily basis, and my hair does look (somewhat fuller). No, it's not a miracle cure, there isn't new hair, but I think the hair I have is probably thicker. And it's about the same price as any other shampoo without having all those chemicals and emulsifiers in it. So, seems pretty good to me.
Product Description: Deeply nourish and hydrate fine, thinning hair with Avalon Organics Biotin B-Complex Thickening Conditioner. Made with organic botanicals and essential oils, this pH balanced formula conditions hair from the follicle through the entire shaft to invigorate the scalp and enhance hair volume. A carefully balanced blend of biotin, saw palmetto, quinoa protein and vitamin E work in harmony to strengthen hair strands and help build body, leaving hair feeling thicker and softer. This EWG VERIFIED, certified organic conditioner is made with non-GMO ingredients and no parabens, harsh preservatives, synthetic colors or fragrances, phthalates or sulfates. It is also vegan and not tested on animals. Includes one 14 oz. bottle of Avalon Organics Biotin B-Complex Thickening Conditioner. Title: Doesn't soften or detangle
Body: I'm not sure what this is supposed to be. It's thick like a lotion but does not condition hair. I used it on my daughter who has waist-length hair, and the "conditioner" didn't soften the hair nor did it untangle it at all. I have short chin-length hair and it's ok to use on mine but I will not buy it again.

Title: Excellent product for me
Body: I bought the shampoo and conditioner both trying to curb the thining and weakening of my hair.  I decided for the price it was worth a gamble and I after a few weeks I am very happy I gave it a shot.  The shampoo has a strong wake up fragrance and on a Monday at 6:00 in the morning we all could use a little help waking up.  For lathering it does a very good job and my hair feels clean and great.  I use the conditioner daily and I feel that it has helped not only with strenth of my hair but also adds to the control I am actually using less product now in my hair because my hair will stay put and I am no longer trying to keep it tame on windy days.  Not really any drawbacks on either right now and if you are thining a little or want to boost your hairs strength I would say give it shot. I notice that there is not hair in the sink in the mornings anymore and I contribute it to the shampoo and conditioner.  This is much cheaper then Nioxin and I think it does just as good and even better job.

Title: It works!
Body: This is my first time trying this conditioner. I'm pleasantly surprised that it really makes my fine hair feel thicker. The texture is very thick though. I can't really squeeze it out of the spout so I place it upside down and unscrew the whole cap to get what I need. I have no problem with that. The fragrance is a pleasant, light, green woody aroma that's quite pleasant.

Title: It smells great and feels good to use an organic product
Body: It smells great and feels good to use an organic product. However, it takes great effort to rinse it all out, and even then there is still a residue. It caused my scalp to break out. I thought the reaction was due to a different product and reordered when I ran out. The 2nd bottle arrived with the lid off. It leaked out all over the Amazon box, on my doorstep, and ruined a section of the wood floor inside the house when it was brought in. It should really have a seal under the lid to protect during shipping.

Title: Husband who has been loosing his hair early, still ...
Body: Husband who has been loosing his hair early, still is after various Biotin shampoos including this one. HIs hair, though, is very soft now and looks shiny healthy, but he is balding more than ever. I started loosing my long below my shoulder hair recently and it was knotting for the first time ever as I approach 50 yo, but once on this and other natural shampoos and conditions I'm not loosing anywhere near as much.

Title: Gives the appearance of thicker hair.
Body: I have changed an earlier review on this product. My fault, I was a newbie to the reviewer world and I failed to realize the importance of tried and true testing. 160 reviews later I get it. It took 3 different products and a very specific combination of products to achieve the texture that I was looking for.Me - 28 this month. V shaped hairline. Hairstyle - long enough to run a comb through, usually let it grow for 1.5 months then cut back.The Biotin B-Complex conditioner is a daily counterbalance to the Biotin Shampoo. The Shampoo is harsh but effective. It leaves my hair feeling like a brillo pad and the conditioner helps break that apart. When used together the signs of balding are significantly reduced (seeing your scalp through the hair). Also, my hairstyle is a lot easier and fuller looking (messy and pushed up in the front).Even with the combination I found my hair needing a break from the two. I use Organix Coconut milk conditioner once a week to soften my hair. This is an extremely effective break.The proportions I use suit my taste. The appearance of thickness is all I really care about. I know i'll go bald eventually which is why i'm putting the work in the gym now. You have to be in shape if you're bald :)

Title: Not sure if I love it yet.
Body: It's so hard to find shampoo and conditioner that are natural and sulphate free/safe for colored hair for a reasonable price. I really like the Avalon Organics Thickening Shampoo. I am not certain if I love this corresponding conditioner, though.I find that when I put it in my hair I still can't run my fingers through my hair to comb out the knots. It's like my hair just sucks it in and then I feel like maybe I need to put more in (which I refuse to do because then I'll run out too fast). After I blow dry my hair it looks great, though.I am going to finish the bottle before I decide whether I continue buying this one.

Title: thick buy oily
Body: To begin, I would like to note that I definitely like the shampoo much more than the conditioner.  I have now been using the combination of Biotin B shampoo and conditioner for about 2 months now.  I would also like to explain a little bit about my hair - I have medium shoulder length, straight hair.  I have very oily skin, which then gets my hair oily by the end of the day.  My scalp also gets very itchy, something I have attributed to an allergy in the "chemical" shampoos (I formerly used Artec by Loreal professional, Joico, and Matrix).  I also swim in a chlorinated pool on a fairly regular basis.Pros: organic - need I say more? gentle - I takes away my itch, and I have not had any other problems with dandruff or anything. The first ingredient listed is Aloe.So/So: smell  - not super yummy, but not intolerable eitherCons: Tangles!!!  No matter how much I use, the conditioner does not detangle my hair.  I let my hair dry, almost completely before I comb it (sometimes that's hard)  Oil fields.  For some reason, this conditioner really makes my hair oily.  Before I even get out of the shower, my hair is so gluey, oily, and just not even nice.  I let it just dry that way, to see if it's only appearing oily while it's wet; nope.  It weighed down my hair, and it just wasn't as flowy and light.  To help, (I really wanted to give the combination a good go) I began not completely rinsing the shampoo out of my hair prior to adding the conditioner.  I would then completely rinse the shampoo and conditioner simultaneously.  This did alleviate a good chunk of the oil, but my hair still felt weighed down.Quantity to condition.  In order to get the conditioner to completely get to all of my hair, I had to use a ton!  It is really thick, and hard to spread throughout my hair.  I ended up running out of conditioner at the time that my shampoo was half empty.As far as "thickening" goes, I have noticed with using the combination of shampoo + conditioner, that my hair is not necessarily thicker, however, I have noticed that as I wash/condition my hair, less hair falls out during the showering process.  I used to have so much hair in the drain after a shower that my boyfriend used to joke, "how are you not bald by now?!?", but now I only loose maybe 7 or so hairs in the shower.  A MAJOR decrease.  With less hair falling out, I would certainly say that my hair is able to "thicken", not on an individual strand level, but overall my head of hair is thicker.Would I purchase again - yes/no.  I would purchase the shampoo again (I overall liked the way it cleaned, and made my scalp feel), but I would probably not purchase the conditioner again.  I suppose I will continue on the hunt for the perfect shampoo/conditioner combo.

Title: 5 months after.. Good improvement!
Body: So i have been using the Avalon Organics both Shampoo and Conditioner for a few months now. I have seen a pretty good result. My hair has definitely gotten a bit thicker and stronger. I notice less hair falling out. I have combined this shampoo/conditioner with also taking Biotin Supplements so i do not know if its solely because of the shampoo/conditioner or a combination between the both, but improvement is there. My only one complain is that the conditioner doesnt give you that soft conditioner feel other conditioners give you.. Its a little rough as oppose to soft. In conclusion, if you have thin hair i recommend both products as well to supplement with a daily Biotin vitamin.

Title: Made my hair thinner and ratty. Was a set ...

Title: Avalon Organics Biotin B Complex Thickening Conditioner 14 oz Review
Body: The product smells great. It rinses very clean. I like that it is PH balanced. As far as living up to the 'thickening' part of the title, I cannot say that my hair has thickened. I am almost all the way through the bottle,  and while my hair feels cleaner, I would not say it feels thicker. I would still buy the product again however, just for the other reasons I listed previously. I am using the shampoo in conjunction also. SLK

Title: Super thick conditioner!
Body: I bought this conditioner to pair with the shampoo from the same line.  I can't really speak to its claim of thicker hair because in all fairness, I've only used it for a few weeks. And in all fairness, I did not read through the entire list of ingredients. With that being said, one of the ingredients is dimethicone, which may or may not clog pores. I'm currently suffering from major hair fall out and have been looking for shampoos and conditioners without dimethicone and other questionable ingredients. So when I saw dimethicone, I immediately avoided using it on my scalp and just apply it on the hair only. It doesn't really do much for my hair but I accidentally found out that it works great if you leave it in your hair as a leave-in to obtain effortless beachy waves. Also, the conditioner is super thick, making it very difficult to dispense--so difficult that it hurts my hand to force it out of the bottle. Overall, I will not be repurchasing this for three reasons: 1) difficult to dispense, 2) has dimethicone, 3) does absolutely nothing else for my hair other than give me waves if used as a leave-in. As for the shampoo, I'm going to test it out a few more weeks. The shampoo does not contain dimethicone though.

Title: Don't believe everything you read
Body: Based on the reviews I read prior to my purchase, I expected my hair to feel fuller and thicker. It did not...My hair felt stiff and brittle. I tried it a second time and this time I could see my hair breaking off in my hand...the smell was great and that is about all. I am so disappointed in the purchase, price and end result of the product that I could shoot myself for such a waste....Don't count on it working for you. :(while the conditioner is thick, it does not offer a silky feeling to your hair. I found my hair hard to untangle and I spent a great deal of time delicately untangling my fine long hair to prevent further damage.I have gotten better results from generic conditioners like Suave than I could ever get from this product.What an incredible waste of money.

Title: I like this conditioner
Body: Overall, I like this conditioner. What drew me to the product was the quality of ingredients and the rating of it on a trusted health and wellness website but I don't think that I will re-order it as I was not blown away with the results.I usually massage this into my roots and then use a more moisturizing conditioner (Sukin protein conditioner- seriously AMAZING if you haven't tried it) on the length and ends of my hair. I only really use this on my roots because I didn't find it particularly moisturizing on the length and ends of my long hair (past mid back) and I think that it is better suited to a scalp application anyways because it's purpose is hair growth- why waste it on the length and ends? When I did use it on my whole head it did not distribute very well and did pretty much nothing for the manageability of my hair.

Title: 1 star for conditioner 2 stars for shampoo
Body: Shampoo pros:1. Smells good and does not scream," I am super crunchy and organic."2. Suds really really really well which was a shocker for me since shampoo is SLS free (*part of the cons below)3. Hair feels clean4. Hair stays clean same amount of days as with traditional shampooCons:1. At first I thought there were not any, but then I realized despite feeling like I removed all the shampoo, I could still make suds when rubbing my head. So it took 4 complete washing a to get shampoo out of my hair! "Complete" = vigorously washing hair until everything feels clean and sectioning hair while angling head toward faucet and then turning off the water.2. Do not know if the shampoo or conditioner is the culprit but my hair had never had so many tangles!! Normally my hair is flat to my scalp, neck, and back after showering, by with this shampoo and conditioner mix my hair is a nest of out of control tangles!!! *see attached photos.Conditioner is worth one star.Pros:1. Smells niceCons:1. Looks thick but doesn't spread well at all. Think applying thick body lotion to your hair.2. Hair is a tangled mess!!

Title: Not impressed
Body: We were pretty disappointed with this shampoo and conditioner. Had high hopes for it, and it did not deliver.The smell was okay.It was harsh and stripping on the hair follicles.Left our hair with that squeaky clean feeling, but not in a good way, more in a removed all the oil from your hair kinda away.Even in using the conditioner, my hair still looked frizzy. And I do not have frizzy hair! Mine is fine, thin, and straight. If anything I usually border on having my hair be too silky and need things to volumize it.Just cannot recommend this product.

Title: too heavy for my hair
Body: I was very excited about this product after reading its reviews but was disappointed. The smell does not bother me at all. First of all, it is really hard to squeeze out of the bottle. The conditioner is kind of heavy and it seems like you have to use a lot of it to evenly spread it on you hair. I've used it and I've noticed that I'm pulling even more hair out while rinsing this conditioner. After drying, my hair looked kind of greasy/oily. At the end of the day I felt like I have to wash my hair again. I didn't like that. I gave it many tries and it had the same effect. I love their shampoo and I use it, but I didn't like this conditioner.

Title: Biotin Thickening Conditioner
Body: Following my review on the Biotin Thickening Shampoo - I do not care for this product at all. The smell is very similar to lemon Pledge or Lysol. When I first opened the conditioner, it was really a really thick and creamy appearance, but the second I put it in my hair, it lost all of its integrity and seemingly barely covered my hair! I usually start applying at my tips and slowly working my way up to about 4" away from my roots, but I was having such a hard time working it up that I had to reapply a couple times. What a waste of conditioner! When I rinsed it out, my hair had a dry and straw-ish consistency. Not very pleased. I do notice that my hair has grown a bit faster this past month or two. I'm unsure if that's due to the Biotin supplements or the shampoo/conditioner. I just end up throwing a bunch of Dove brand leave-in conditioner because of the way this shamp/cond leaves my hair.

Title: Great Conditioner, Get the Shampoo too!
Body: I have Protein issues therefore my hair these past couple of years have thinned (maybe too cuz I'm getting old)...but this conditioner used with their shampoo makes my hair feel thicker and healthier. I have long color treated hair and when using this product I find my hair is easy to manage after shampooing, no tangles. I not only recommend this product but I bought several bottles since my first purchase.BTW the price is not bad, since it takes a few drops to do the job, even with long hair. Enjoy!

Title: Losing less hair!  See detailed review.
Body: 6/8/2013, first review: I thought to review this product as time goes on. I've only been using it for a week, so I do not expect to see hair growth at this point.  It's good to note that I'm 42 years old, w/disturbing hair loss.The bottles are SMALL so I'm not using it carelessly. The smell is not flowery & fun, but it's more medicinal in scent, not overpowering. The shampoo lathers if you work at it, & it's a low lather rather than a high and luffy one. I rub it gently on my scalp & throughout my hair. If scrub too hard, I'll lose MORE HAIR. :( I am washing my hair every day, where I used to wash every other day. The conditioner does not lather.  It's more of a cream that I rub gently onto wet hair. My hair feels sort of weighty as I wash it & I think that I'm going to have a BAD HAIR DAY ahead of me, but after styling, it's actually soft, manageable, not weighty! After washing, I wrap in a towel for about 5 minutes, apply FINESSE styling mousse, let my brown curls air dry. Sometimes a touch of hairspray but most days, not. With the thick feel in the shower, I am surprised that it's not weighted down after styling. SO, I'll keep on trying this for 3 months. I'll try to remember to update if I see a difference. Feel free to ask me questions.**IT'S IMPORTANT TO MENTION THAT ALONG W/THE SHAMPOO & CONDITIONER, I'M TAKING, MAXI HAIR SUPPLEMENTS.  My Dr. was pleased w/the ingredients of the shamp, cond AND supplements. I use the supplements in place of a multi so I also take OMEGA 3 & Calcium Citrate w/ D3. (As per Dr).**6/27/2013 - Although there is NO new hair growth, I've noticed that I'M LOSING LESS HAIR when I wash & style!  It's enough for me to notice & enough for me to keep going w/ this trial. 19 days in, w/ consistent use of shamp/cond & Maxi Hair, my hair is smoother, softer, shinier stronger, doesn't have a bad smell, still not weighty & continues to be manageable. I feel like whatever residue was clogging my hair is out. My hope is that this is the case for my scalp & maybe, just maybe, I'll see some new sprouts. A girl can dream. :)6/30/2013 - Could it be?  New hair?  Will keep you posted.  I see three short hairs poking through!  I should also note that my nails need to be trimmed more often than ever, and I have to shave, (legs, underarms), more frequently!  I suspect this would be from the internal good I'm getting from the Maxi-Hair supplement.7/21/2013 - YES!  Still losing less hair, AND there IS new hair growth in little stray spots.  My nails, which I keep short, need to be cut once every week to 10 days as opposed to once every 3 or more weeks!  I rcvd two complements on my hair this past week, about how shiny &healthy it looks!  I remain faithful to the products, using them EVERY DAY as recommended.9/21/13 - IMPORTANT UPDATE.  It seems that with months of use, this product is GREAT for clearing up any residue on my scalp, BUT it is drying out my hair.  I have to rotate my use of this and the conditioner.  It's stripping the oils from my hair.  I will still use the shampoo and conditioner, but may just use it once a week.  WIll keep updating.  I did notice that for the past two weeks, when I use the products, my scalp gets just a little itchy.  That also indicates to me that the residue blocking my pores may be cleared up!  That is the good part!  SO, I will be using the MAXI HAIR daily as bottle recommends, but will limit the use of the shampoo and conditioner.

Title: I like that this product is a conscientious purchase and I ...
Body: I like that this product is a conscientious purchase and I like the herbal smell.  However, shampoo is very runny, easy to over pour and there is little sudsing.  I run in heat and humidity and don't feel my hair gets very clean after shampooing. The conditioner does not condition at all, really.  It comes out of the bottle thick, but is strangely dry on my hair.  My long hair is full of knots after using the shampoo/conditioner.  And hair still comes out of my head in clumps.  I know this gets great reviews and clearly works for a lot of people.  Not me and I won't purchase again.

Title: Good stuff!
Body: My hair was breaking off so much after I stopped getting perms. I have naturally very fine hair being mixed but for some reason I always got relaxers and it left my hair very thin. Title: Great Product! Beware of Seller!
Body: It's not that the product is bad, it amazing. I highly recommend it. The seller on the other hand gave me nothing but problems. For example - marking the item as "sent", then emailed me to tell me it was out of stock. Why would you mark it as sent? Nothing but troubles. Amazon was amazing as always and cleared everything up and issued a refund. All in all..product is great, just dont buy it from this seller.

Title: Great smell

Title: good conditioner for dry, itchy scalp
Body: This conditioner is great for dandruff or dry scalp.  It tingles when you use it and makes your hair shiny and with minimal breakage.Do not use on color-treated hair. It contains "mint" which will make your hair fade & use its vibrant color.  I used this product and found out the hard way.  I used to dye my hair blonde and it would make my color fade fast!  I ended up letting my husband use it (so we aren't wasting it) and I discontinued the use.  Tea-tree is an excellent choice for dry scalp, just use one without mint if you have color-treated hair.

Title: If you like glue in your hair, you will love this!

Title: Opposite Effect for me
Body: I was very excited about trying the shampoo and conditioner for my thinning hair issue.  My hair has been coming out a bit before this but I was completely surprised when using it the first time, SO MUCH of my hair came out in the shower & when I was coming it out afterward that I started crying!!!  I skipped washing my hair for one day and then used it again just to see if I was imaginging it.  Well I wasn't because it happened again.  I went to Ulta and purchased some Nioxin which I've used before and washed my hair with it this morning.  Only a little bit of my hair came out...and by little bit, I mean more than the average person but WAY less than when I used the Biotin B-Complex.  Im glad it works for some people and hope it works for you.  I tried it due to all of the positive reviews and although I hardly ever review anything, I felt so strongly about my experience that I had to share it. I am sending this product back today!  Good Luck~

Title: Body only , also makes hair stronger, may need to add a moisturizer
Body: Bought to add body and it does that. However, since I color my hair, it is drying.  Bought at Costco.  The reason for this review is knowledge gained from years of using hair products on dyed hair.  Protein conditioners which is what this is, add body and not moisture.  If you rinse this , your body product, and add a moisture conditioner, rinse.  The protein must be used first. Repairs.

Title: Great for thick curly damaged hair!!
Body: You guys gotta try this conditioner. I have thick curly hair but it tends to frizz and damage and split a ton. With this conditioner, I use it as shampoo and detangle/wash it out, and then use it as conditioner and leave it in my hair. My hair is so much stronger, easy to detangle, and I don't lose as many hairballs when I wash it anymore!!!! Love it.

Title: Undoubtedly the worst conditioner I have ever used
Body: Undoubtedly the worst conditioner I have ever used. I am a Caucasian female with extremely curly hair. This product did absolutely NO conditioning. I use a wide-toothed comb to brush the snarls out of my hair in the shower. This product offered no assistance or conditioning to my hair. My hair feels extremely dry. (It should be noted that I rarely use any heat on my hair whatsoever, I just let my curls air-dry.) I also have not noticed any thickening to my hair. I will not be re-ordering this product.

Title: a shampoo is most effective when it can build up a good lather and foam up nicely
Body: I don't usually write negative reviews since customers aren't always looking for the same things. I thought I would warn future buyers of a few negative aspects I personally experienced.1. I believe this shampoo was watered down at some point. Through experience, a shampoo is most effective when it can build up a good lather and foam up nicely. It takes 2 full tablespoons to get that result with this product. I don't believe that's normal.2. The shampoo is quite drying and makes my hair feel like straw. All my short whisps reach for the sky. (Even with the same brand conditioner). This is what I'm trying to avoid!I suspect different hair types will react differently, so here's the makeup of mine: My hair isn't thick or thin. It takes to curling quickly and has natural waves if I let it air dry. I've colored it on and off for 20 years but in the last 6 months or so I've gone natural - no hair products with harsh chemicals; I went no-poo for a short while. Now I use Dessert Essence shampoo/conditioner (SO much better!), coconut oil, argan oil, jojoba, and the occasional egg mask.I hope this helps!

Title: Good job at looking thicker
Body: This shampoo has some pro's: Hair feels thicker, looks thicker, more volume.and some con's: Need to use a whole lot of it because it barely "suds." After rinsing it out, my hair looks and feels extremely dry and brittle (wet and dry). But, it is a thickening shampoo, and I guess if it makes my hair look thicker, it does what it says.

Title: Drying, dull, thick

Title: Adds some volume but...

I've never really had this problem with any other organic or conventional hair product.

Title: My current "it" conditoner!
Body: So far my new favorite shampoo/conditioner combo...  My hair is fine, but there is lots of it, and it tends to get oily at the roots.  I usually keep 2 brands to alternate, and this shampoo/conditioner has definitely earned a spot in the rotation.Feels a little hard to get spread and get even coverage, but it rinses easily and gets the job done.I've found that for the first time (since I started highlighting my hair about 8 years ago) I can let my hair air dry, and it feels really soft, and doesn't look frizzy.  It's noticeably healthier.  I use this probably 4-5 days/week (for about the last 6 months), and then alternate in another brand the other two.  Plus is has the feel good, and being sulfate free makes a HUGE difference in how it affects my hair texture.The smell is a little different -- not exactly girly, but still fresh, and certainly not offensive or a reason for me to not use these.Currently my favorite shampoo/conditioner, hands down.

Title: This Conditioner is Terrible!
Body: The consistency of this conditioner is somewhat like wallpaper paste. It does not come out of the container easily AT all and is almost impossible to spread throughout your hair. I've used it twice and have already went through 1/3rd of the bottle! It leaves my hair a tangled mess and I can't work it into my scalp enough to even reach the areas where I need to regrow hair.This is terrible for long hair, would NOT reccomend.

Title: Won't buy again
Body: This was my first time using Avalon Organics, so I don't know if this is reflective of all they products or just this thickening conditioner. I purchased this conditioner, not because I wanted thicker hair but I wanted to try their natural conditioners and this was the least expensive one I found. I found it to be very sticky and seem to stick to my fingers more than my hair. Also, didn't seem to offer any detangling for my longer hair. Every time I used it I ended up having to add another condition in just to actually get my fingers through my hair

Title: Great product -- mild texture and scent that we love.
Body: We bought this shampoo to use in our guest bathroom, but ended up using it for ourselves. Once we tried it we couldn't put it back in the guest bathroom! My husband and I love this conditioner and the Tea Tree Mint shampoo. Great combination.It has a mild texture and scent, which we appreciate (we don't love strong products with overwhelming fragrance). The ingredient list is also a plus. The conditioner doesn't leave a lot of product in your hair once you rinse. Personally, I like this, but some might view it as too 'weak'.We would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a healthy feeling, simple and natural conditioner.

Title: I don't like it.
Body: I had just purchased the Avalon SHAMPOO (Thickening), which I really liked, so I thought I'd try the conditioner.  Ummm, it does nothing.  It is like an ANTI-conditioner.  I even tried using a ton of it for my long hair, and it did nothing.  Did not make it feel soft or anything.  Basically seemed like scented, thickened water on my hair.  I do like the Shampoo though, and bought another one of those.

Title: GREAT BOTANICAL CONDITIONER FOR LUXURIOUS HAIR!!!
Body: I have been using this conditioner for about three weeks and I am impressed with this conditioner.  It really is thickening.  It leaves my hair feeling vey healthy.  It is very creamy and easy to work through hair.  It rinses out very quickly for a conditioner.  It does not smell like a chemical plant as another reviewer stated.  It does not leave your hair feeling like straw as another reviewer stated.  It really smells like an expensive botanical Aveda product for a fraction of the cost.  At $4.xx I will keep buying.  Vegan is good.  Buying this is doing the right thing.  BUY AND ENJOY!

Title: The 2017 version was too thick to squeeze out of a bottle
Body: I'm a relatively young person with strong small hands. But I can't use my fingers to squeeze this conditioner out of the bottle. Its viscosity is somewhere around room-temp cream cheese. Imagine trying to squeeze cream cheese through a 5mm x 2mm hole. I have to use the palms of both my hands to do it. It should be packaged in a moisturizing cream pot. Current packaging is not accessible to people with small hands, arthritis, or any kind of hand injury.

Title: Great smell, and softening, but thickening? How so?
Body: This had great reviews so I thought I would try this set for my fine, straight hair. The aromatic fragrance of bergamot is intoxicating and it left my hair feeling soft, shiny and well hydrated but I have noticed NO difference in thickness or volume. It's a GREAT natural shampoo and conditioner at a really great price but I would not describe it as thickening or volumizing. I will buy it again because:I LOVE the smell, it is a great value for sulfate-free, natural haircare, it does not strip moisture, and my hair feels healthy... I just wish it thickened a tiny bit!

Title: TOO THICK AND IT DOES NOT CONDITION THE HAIR
Body: This conditioner is way too thick, like a paste (see pic) and it does not come out of the bottle easily. If you get a lump on your hand, it is hard to dissolve to spread on hair. If you manage to put a lump on your hair, it does not condition, so it fails its purpose.I am not really sure if the consistency is supposed to be this thick or if the product is old.I am not the only one complaining about that . Wish I have read their review before ordering.

Title: Does thicken somewhat, but fragrance is unpleasant.
Body: I bought the shampoo and conditioner, and have noticed that my hair is somewhat thicker.  It is necessary to use non-thickening wash & condition products every 6 or so washes, to prevent drying buildup; a fact that they don’t share with customers.  I don’t care for the fragrance, but that is subjective.  Perhaps, you will like it.

Title: Good combo but beware if you have thick hair
Body: I purchased this shampoo/ conditioner combo and it smells nice& clean, it does NOT leave a strong smell once my hair is dry- which I prefer, it gets my hair clean and it feels much fuller after I wash it and my hair drys. 4 stars because I have extremely thick hair & a lot of it and I feel like I have to use a ton of product for it to cover all my hair. I will continue to buy for my husband though.

Title: More like a body lotion; less like a conditioner.
Body: I chose this conditioner because I am trying to go organic as much as possible. Having said that, I ordered this conditioner because it promises to thicken the hair shaft naturally; however, when I applied it through my hair, it did little if anything to de-tangle. It reminds me of body lotion and it might as well have been. I had to use my regular conditioner to de-tangle. I pulled more hair out trying to work this stuff through my hair. I have medium long, fine hair. Maybe it's more effective for hair that's too short to tangle...Not a total lods, though; I'm using the rest of it as a shaving creme!

Title: super watered down
Body: This conditioner not only seems watered down but it really doesnt do much for my hair either.  I have to use a trememdously large amount in order to get any type of actual conditioning feeling in my hair with this...literally 1/4-1/3 of a cup worth. This wouldnt be SO bad if i didnt have super fine and thin hair to begin with and its short so there should be no reason i should have to use this much conditioner.  I have used many different organic types of shampoo/conditioner and never have had to use this much.  I was really excited to get this conditioner but honestly it is not at all worth the money paid for it.  Very dissappointed

Title: Very drying to the hair.
Body: I just finished my first bottle of this product. I am in my early 50s, my hair tends to be oily and I have an unacceptable amount of shedding which is the reason I chose this formula. The smell is great but the conditioner doesn't moisturize very well even if you leave it on for 4-5 minutes. I eventually bought Aussie 3-minute Miracle to put on the ends and that did help me get through the bottle. I am reordering the matching shampoo but will look for something else for conditioning. I just wish there were a conditioner that had both Biotin and Saw Palmetto.

Title: It did nothing but dry out my hair.
Body: In the last year or so I've noticed that I am losing a lot more hair than I would like or would like to admit. I wanted to try something natural. I used this for a month and noticed no difference in hair loss but it totally dried out my hair. So much so that I had to cut 4 inches off. I have color processed hair and I'm not sure if that is why I had this reaction. All the reviews were so positive here and I was really hopeful. I ended up buy Rogaine and that has made a huge difference.

Title: Stopped working!
Body: When I first started using this back in February 2013, my thinning hair stopped shedding completely! A few weeks ago the shedding picked up again, unfortunately. I loved this shampoo and conditioner while it was working. I also feel like an idiot for not noticing the sulfates and other damaging ingredients in it. How can it be labeled organic when it's loaded with sulfates? Very disappointed and won't be buying again. Check your labels, I've noticed a lot of shampoos that claim to be organic have sulfates!

Title: Not very "organic"
Body: Tried this product to help my husbands thinning hair, we found instead though that it only irritated his scalp and gave him bad scaly psoriasis for a few weeks until he stopped using it. We didn't notice any thickening effect from it whatsoever and were disappointed it wasn't as "organic or natural as it'd lead you to believe. It received a 3 on EWG toxicity ratings. I try only to use products 1 or 2.

Title: It's ok

Title: Not particularly thickening
Body: Decent enough product in terms of conditioning, but I didn't find that it had any particular thickening effect on my hair. Without that, it was just another organic, vegan conditioner - in my opinion, there are better mid-grade natural conditioners out there for the price! I do appreciate that it is vegan and cruelty-free, but is expensive overall for no real particular benefit outside the norm. I wouldn't buy it again, but it wasn't awful.

Title: Stimulates my scalp, and has good nourishing ingredients.
Body: I have been using Avalon Thickening Conditioner for about 2 years now, and I'm pleased with this product. The conditioner has a quite an extensive list of natural oils and ingredients. I can say for sure that the stimulating scalp part does work because I can feel a slight tingling in my scalp just after I use it. I believe this is for stimulating blood flow to the scalp. It does nourish my hair without leaving it feeling too greasy when it dries out.There isn't a strong scent to this conditioner, but it does have a slight earthy or bark-like aromatic smell as you're applying it. As you can tell from the picture the consistency is very similar to hand lotion.I'm mostly pleased by the ingredients for a natural way to thicken hair growth without using the toxic ingredients in other brands at the grocery store. The price is usually pretty excellent on Amazon compared to my local health store. I will continue to use it.

Title: Great product, however...
Body: I am a 28 year old caucasian female with super curly hair. Over years of flat iron and hair dye abuse, my hair had become stringy and limp and thin. I have been taking oral Biotin vitamins for many years now and was very happy with the results. When I saw this product I was stoked because I could nourish my hair from the inside and out now. I read the reviews about the smell and thought it was a small price to pay for thick healthy hair. I bought the conditioner instead of the shampoo because I figured I could mix this conditioner with my other smell-good conditioner and get the benefits with a better smell. I was right. If you buy this conditioner and mix it with another conditioner (I use a replenishing Redken one), you can get the best of both worlds, awesome softness and smell, with thicker healthier hair. The conditioner has saw palmetto in it which I assume is why the conditioner smells a little like a plant. After only a couple of uses I have noticed a lot less hair falling out in my hands and my hair is fuller and feels stronger. I love this conditioner and will keep buying it!

Title: Whole Family Loves!
Body: Bought to go with the shampoo, nothing has ever worked and smelled so good as this.  Usually with organic shampoos and conditioners you have to cake on the shampoo and conditioners, not these.  When first using the conditioner it may seem as if you need to use more than normal, but give it some work first.  Use what you would normally use, and gently work it around the ends of your hair, really rubbing it all around, then move your way up, you should have plenty.  Then let it sit for a few minutes before rinsing (I shampoo my hair first thing, put the conditioner in, then wash my face and body, shave, then rinse the conditioner out lightly).  My hair is so soft, styles well, no frizz, and feels so good! I will never change shampoo/conditioners again!(See my review for the shampoo under the same headline).

Title: Avalon Organics Thickening Conditioner: Give It More Than One Try
Body: I thought after one try that I would pitch it - it felt waxy and my hair felt unclean. But after combing and blow drying, the results were definitely clear - my hair was visibly thicker looking. I've been using the shampoo/conditioner for 2 weeks now and my hair looks better than it has in a long time. If you past the texture and feel of the product, you will like the results.

Title: DOES NOT CONDITION HAIR - READ THE REVIEWS
Body: What a mistake I made. The item is NOT RETURNABLE to Amazon. This conditioner is awful, it is like putting Elmer's glue paste onto your hair. $6.62 in the garbage. It does NOT condition hair. It does NOT detangle hair. It is absolutely awful. Both a male with short hair and female with long hair tried this product and it is absolute and utter garbage.DO NOT make the mistake I made. This is one of the few products I ordered without reading reviews. MISTAKE.If I haven't made myself clear, DO NOT ORDER THIS CONDITIONER. It is TRASH. If you still don't believe me, ORDER IT FROM SOMEWHERE YOU CAN MAKE RETURNS. No thanks Amazon for this glue paste conditioner.ZERO STARS.

Title: I'm sure there are those out there that love it, I'm just not one of them.
Body: I'm sure there are those out there that love it, I'm just not one of them. I'm also sure it is better for your hair, but I just can't use it. I have thick wavy hair and it takes quite a bit of this stuff to get my hair done. Also, it really just feels like I am putting thick lotion in my hair. It doesn't give that soft hair feel that I'm used to. Maybe it isn't supposed to, but with my hair texture, I NEED the smoothing that a thick conditioner provides.I will keep trying to use it and see if I can up this rating with results I get from using it. Also, the price is too high.

Title: I wish there was a way to give zero stars.
Body: I wish there was a way to give zero stars. I bought this so that I could be more environmentally friendly while at the same time cutting down the number of things I can't pronounce in my products. This one sucks :-( My hair following the first shampoo felt heavy and static-y. After the second wash, I ended up re-washing with Pantene. I understand that lather/suds can probably be contributed to some sort of chemical reaction, but at least you know you've washed your hair. With this shampoo, don't hope for any lather or evidence that you've just put something in your hair.

Title: So far...so good! Ordered the Shampoo & cinditioner.

My hair smells good & feels so clean.The reviewers that state the shampoo does not lather...YES it does lather quite well just like any other shampoo. The shampoo has a pleasant mint tea scent.I will add to this review weeks later to let everyone know IF it thickens my hair.

Title: Suddenly stopped working
Body: When I first started using this back in February 2013, my thinning hair stopped shedding completely! A few weeks ago the shedding picked up again, unfortunately. I loved this shampoo and conditioner while it was working. I also feel like an idiot for not noticing the sulfates and other damaging ingredients in it. How can it be labeled organic when it's loaded with sulfates? Very disappointed and won't be buying again. Check your labels, I've noticed a lot of shampoos that claim to be organic have sulfates!

Title: Nothing special
Body: I have been switching all my hair care products over to shampoos and conditioners that do not contain sodium laureth and other harm chemicals as well as house hold cleaners. I have done plenty of research on all the chemicals we put into our bodies on a daily basis. Based on reviews I tried this as well as John Masters and a few others. First thing I noticed was a medicine type smell. I didn't notice any difference in the volume and it seem to leave a slight residue in my hair. I am a shampoo junkie and have tried just about everything that is out there. I think that John Masters and Derm Organics have much better products that do not contain harmful chemicals. Also Bumble & Bumble has a great thickening shampoo and conditioner however they do contain a few extras in the ingredients but not to the extent of many that are on the market today. This also took quite sometime to arrive.

Title: Industrial strength degreaser. "Fullness" is caused by stripping oils and making hair fluffy
Body: I was so very disappointed with my purchase of the Avalon Thickening shampoo and conditioner. I had such high hopes, but in only two shampooings, my hair was noticeably stripped of oils, had that "squeaky clean" feeling you get when using a very harsh product, and it became dry and brittle. It started looking very dull. They use many products that have an oil stripping effect on the hair, like orange oil and lemon oil. You might think because it says, 'oil' that it might add to your hair's shine, but these are ingredients in industrial strength degreasers. This product only damaged my hair. Avalon is only 70% organic and it had a rather unpleasant smell to me. Rather like mosquito repellant or dish soap. Using a harsh product like this is very detrimental for your hair. I know that a lot of people will be drawn to Avalon because of the low price, but if it drastically stripped my extremely oily hair in two shampoos, I can't imagine what it might do to yours. Although my hair is very fine, so perhaps ethnic girls, and women with coarser hair might benefit? I honestly wouldn't recommend it. I'd rather see people get something that will improve their self-esteem immediately, rather than give them new problems to worry about.In desperation I purchased the more expensive Just Naturals system for thinning hair and believe me, it blows Avalon out of the water. In just one shampoo my hair regained it's texture and became so silky it felt like Asian hair. I can't stop touching my hair now and I feel so much more confident. They use incredible ingredients that greatly benefit people with hair loss due to hormonal issues, or who have an increase in DHT. You do pay more than double for that shampoo, but having something that supports your hair, improves the texture, and smells fantastic, was worth it to me. I'm now quite confident in what I'm using and plan to go on using it, regardless of the cost. I'd pay 5x what I'm paying for it now, I love it so much. And their treatment spray is oil based. I use the system twice a day and I'm shocked at how long it is lasting. It has truly been an excellent investment.I would recommend that you shampoo and condition your hair twice a day if you want to see regrowth with any system. This is because one application of shampoo with DHT-fighting ingredients, can only do so much. Your body is constantly generating new hormones and new DHT. By helping to combat it twice a day, you have a better chance of seeing results sooner. This is coming from a 36 year old woman who has been fighting repeated hair loss due to hormonal imbalance from 16 on. Once a day just never cut it for me. Using a leave on treatment like Just Naturals has overnight, can also work wonders. I use it during the day too if I'm not going out.I hope this helps you recover your hair, and your self-esteem, a little faster and more efficiently. :o)

Title: Loved the conditioner until they changed the formula
Body: I cannot believe something so wonderful just changed overnight into sticky glue like waxy goop. I had ordered several bottles because this used to be my "conditioner for life". When I opened the first one and squeezed a little conditioner onto my hand, I thought, oh no, this is not conditioner! I ended up putting it in my hair anyway, and I was terrified. My hair was a sticky, tangly mess, like I had put glue in my hair and really rubbed it in. I opened another bottle, thought, maybe something was wrong with the first one. Same thing. I had send all of it back. They were nice about the return though. This happened a couple of years ago, but I see they still haven't changed the formula back to the good old one, so I thought I should warn others about this "conditioner".

Title: Sad about this product
Body: I hate to have a negative review for a vegan cruelty free product, but I am very disappointed. I have hair to my pants that I wash every 2-3 days (I don't get it colored), and it has always been pretty manageable. I need about double the amount of product that I needed with other conditioners and my hair is left feeling stripped once I rinse it. My hair is so hard to brush after using this conditioner - I have HUGE ratty tangles and have to empty my brush of loose (or ripped out) hair about every time I wash it (I have been using it for a month to see if it would get better as my hair got used to it, but no such luck). When brushing, I can hear my hair ripping and I have more frizz and split ends than I did when I was highlighting my hair every 2 months! The shampoo that pairs with this I started using this week to see if it would be better, and it is actually worse. I LOVE their lotions and face care products, but their B-complex hair products are a bust. :(

Title: So far I like this Avalon Organics shampoo and conditioner
Body: So far I like this Avalon Organics  shampoo and conditioner.  I'm having a problem with thinning hair and nail ridges.  I'm taking Biotin liquid drops and thought I would add in the shampoo not only for the thinning hair but I was starting to get pimples on my scalp on and off and thought perhaps my other shampoo was causing the problem.  Since I have been using the Avalon Organics so far the pimples on my scalp haven't been noticed however I've only been using this duo for two weeks now and the prior occurrences only occurred on and off.  My hair feels silky and not dry that is something I noticed after a few washing's.  I have very short hair so it's hard to tell if it's fuller with body.

Title: I love Avalon Organics
Body: I love Avalon Organics, and I am experienced with organic/natural products--I know they aren't the same as your average Pantene or Suave.  With that in mind, this conditioner was HORRIBLE.  Truly, nothing redeeming about it.  I used the usual amount for the first time, and my hair (shoulder length fine hair) was totally tangled--the conditioner had no effect.So I kept increasing the amount.  This morning, I literally used half a handful--probably 3 Tablespoons--it made my hair a TINY bit less tangly, and not softer at all.

Title: that I like to let air-dry in order to enjoy its natural ...
Body: I have average-to-dry curly hair, that I like to let air-dry in order to enjoy its natural curl. This conditioner is horrible. I've tried it several times just to make sure that it's not a case of my hair needing to adjust. It hardly detangles my hair after shampooing at all. Leaves a greasy, rough film behind, and makes my hair feel coarse, stiff, and weirdly not-even-washed when dry. Worst of all, my hair is so tangled and matted after I wash it that I have to brush it, and I lose all my curls. I am kicking myself for buying a giant bottle of this without ever trying it. That's what I get for letting myself be wooed by the promises on the label.

Title: bad tangles, dried ends
Body: Being a long haired guy, I've developed a preference for the more natural shampoos and conditioners, but really wasn't happy with this. After using this, my hair would be badly tangled and gnarled. Even perhaps matted toward the ends. After I managed to comb through it, my hair wouldn't feel bad for the rest of the day... but something about it really made my hair tangle up and feel really dried up in the ends.

Title: Best Conditioner for Fine Hair!
Body: This is the first conditioner I've ever used that did not weigh my hair down!  I recommend this conditioner (and the Avalon Thickening Shampoo) to anyone with fine hair.  I have alot of hair, but it's fine.  I did not use conditioner for years because of the "weighed down" factor and decided to try Avalon Thickening Conditioner because my hair started to feel very dry.  I like the Avalon Thickening Shampoo and Conditioner better than anything I've purchased at a salon!  The only thing I'm afraid of is that whenever I find a product I like, it ends up being discontinued - hope this never happens with Avalon products!

Title: Helped with hair loss
Body: I bought this along with the shampoo because my previous shampoo was making my hair fall. After some months of usage I can't say for sure if it thickened my hair but at least it helped stop the loss. It leaves my hair very manageable as well. This conditioner is very thick and it didn't take a lot to detangle my hair. Will buy again.

Title: it's alright.
Body: This stuff makes your hair feel thicker after using it and overall is a good product. I have been using it for about 6 months and have not seen any hair-loss prevention or any hair growth what so ever. It is very reasonably priced and does leave my hair feeling thicker and better looking than other shampoos i've tried. I do think it promotes your hair to produce more oils though, it is pretty potent. After about 12-14 hours my forehead and scalp seem more oily than in the past since using this product, but nothing terrible or alarming.The smell could be better. It doesn't necessarily smell bad, but it kinda smells like lemony dish soap or like dial hand soap--like some commercial bathroom product--But you gotta hand it to them, it smells pretty damn good for a product having Saw Palmetto berries in it--in case you were unaware, saw palmetto extract and berries smell like pure vomit and death...lol! Don't worry you can't smell the saw palmetto at all. It is not strong scented, you'll just have a light fragrance of some industrial lemon-like handsoap while washing your hair.For the price, it's definitely worth it to at least try.

Title: Doesn't live up to its promises
Body: Rather than leaving my hair softer and more manageable (which is a conditioner's most basic function), this conditioner left a noticeable, waxy residue in my hair. I wonder if this gross waxy film is what makes your hair feel "thicker and fuller". It does not glide on to hair very smoothly and smells like Pine Sol. Major disappointment. I won't be ordering this again and I would hesitate to try any other hair products offered by this company.

Title: Great stuff for any hair type!
Body: Typically when you think of Biotin you think of products that require you to have very thin (or thinning hair), or at least that is what I always thought.  I tried this product because even though I have a lot of hair, it is fine and I heard biotin might aid in the strength and vitality of the hair follicles.  I have to say that I have loved this product!  I even got my mom using it, and my best friend.I have tried other products of this line as well, and have similarly enjoyed the results!  Try them!

Title: What is this??
Body: Same as its shampoo I put your standard amount of conditioner on my palm expecting a normal experience on wet shampooed hair.  This has nothing and feels like I was massaging my head with air.  I read and reread the instructions.  Nothing.  I then put about a quarter of a cup worth which then seemed to work a bit, but still nothing.  What's the deal?  I don't want to use it any more.  Same with its shampoo.  What's up with this?
